abstract: In a letter to employees, Kevin Johnson, president of Microsoft’s platform and services division, said the challenges of integrating Microsoft and Yahoo are not insurmountable — that is, if the two companies do indeed merge.
snippet: In a letter to employees, Kevin Johnson, president of Microsoft’s platform and services division, said the challenges of integrating Microsoft and Yahoo are not insurmountable — that is, if the two companies do indeed merge.
lead_paragraph: We can do it. We can mesh our technologies and our cultures. And we’ll keep the Yahoo name alive.

headline.main: Microsoft President on Micro-Hoo: We Can Do It
